title: Letters to Mr Dodwell, with Clarke's Defences and Collin's Answers
fulltitle:
Letters to Mr Dodwell

With Clarke's Defences and Collin's Answers
comments: In 1706, Clarke published a Letter to Mr Dodwell, in response to his Epistolary Discourse. Shortly after, Collins published a Letter to the Learned Mr. Henry Dodwell, as a direct response to Clarke's criticisms. A series of public letters between Clarke and Collins followed over the next few years, furthering the debate. They were never published as a set, but it was thought convenient to reproduce them here in that fashion.
